lead_paragraph: The board of Unicredit, the largest Italian bank, on Thursday chose Federico Ghizzoni to succeed Alassandro Profumo, the chief executive who resigned last week after a dispute with the executive board.
snippet: The board of Unicredit, the largest Italian bank, on Thursday chose Federico Ghizzoni to succeed Alassandro Profumo, the chief executive who resigned last week after a dispute with the executive board.

headline.main: Unicredit Names Ghizzoni to Replace Profumo

abstract: The board of Unicredit, the largest Italian bank, on Thursday chose Federico Ghizzoni to succeed Alassandro Profumo, the chief executive who resigned last week after a dispute with the executive board.
